==Events==
*   [[9]] &ndash; [[Arminius]]' alliance of six [[Germanic peoples|Germanic tribes]] ambushes and annihilates three [[Roman legion]]s of [[Publius Quinctilius Varus]] in the [[Battle of the Teutoburg Forest]].
* [[337]] &ndash; [[Constantine II (emperor)|Constantine II]], [[Constantius II]], and [[Constans I]] succeed their father [[Constantine the Great|Constantine I]] as co-emperors. The [[Roman Empire]] is divided between the three [[Augustus (title)|Augusti]].
* [[533]] &ndash; A [[Byzantine army]] of 15,000 men under [[Belisarius]] lands at [[Chebba|Caput Vada]] (modern [[Tunisia]]) and marches to [[Carthage]].
*[[1000]] &ndash; [[Battle of Svolder]], [[Viking Age]].
*[[1087]] &ndash; [[William II of England|William II]] becomes [[King of England]], taking the title [[William II of England|King William II]], (reigned until 1100).
*[[1141]] &ndash;  [[Yelü Dashi]], the [[Liao Dynasty]] general who founded the [[Kara-Khitan Khanate|Qara-Khitai]], defeats the [[Great Seljuq Empire|Seljuq]] and [[Kara-Khanid Khanate|Kara-Khanid]] forces at the [[Battle of Qatwan]].
*[[1379]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Neuberg]], splitting the [[Austria]]n [[Habsburg]] lands between the [[Habsburg]] [[Duke]]s [[Albert III of Austria|Albert III]] and [[Leopold III of Austria (Habsburg)|Leopold III]].
*[[1493]] &ndash; [[Battle of Krbava field]], a decisive defeat of [[Croats]] in [[Croatia in the union with Hungary|Croatian]] struggle against the invasion by the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1513]] &ndash; [[James IV of Scotland]] is defeated and dies in the [[Battle of Flodden Field]], ending [[Scotland]]'s involvement in the [[War of the League of Cambrai]].
*[[1543]] &ndash; [[Mary, Queen of Scots|Mary Stuart]], at nine months old, is [[coronation|crowned]] "[[Queen of Scots]]" in the central [[Scotland|Scottish]] town of [[Stirling]].
*[[1561]] &ndash; The ultimately unsuccessful [[Colloquy at Poissy]] opens in an effort to reconcile [[Roman Catholicism in France|French Catholics]] and [[Huguenots|Protestants]].
*[[1739]] &ndash; [[Stono Rebellion]], the largest slave uprising in [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Britain]]'s mainland [[North America]]n colonies prior to the [[American Revolution]], erupts near [[Charleston, South Carolina]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; The [[Continental Congress]] officially names its new [[Political union|union]] of [[sovereignty|sovereign]] states the [[United States]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; [[Washington, D.C.]], the capital of the United States, is named after President [[George Washington]].
*[[1801]] &ndash; [[Alexander I of Russia]] confirms the privileges of [[Baltic governorates|Baltic provinces]].
*[[1839]] &ndash; [[John Herschel]] takes the first glass plate [[photograph]].
*[[1850]] &ndash; [[California]] is admitted as the thirty-first [[U.S. state]].
*  1850   &ndash; The [[Compromise of 1850]] transfers a third of [[Texas]]'s claimed territory (now parts of [[Colorado]], [[Kansas]], [[New Mexico]], [[Oklahoma]], and [[Wyoming]]) to federal control in return for the U.S. federal government assuming $10 million of [[Texas]]'s pre-annexation debt.
*[[1855]] &ndash; [[Crimean War]]: The [[Siege of Sevastopol (1854–1855)|Siege of Sevastopol]] comes to an end when Russian forces abandon the city.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Union Army]] enters [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; The [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works]] is finalized.
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The creation of the [[Canadian Automobile Machine Gun Brigade]], the first fully mechanized unit in the [[British Army]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[Greco-Turkish War of 1919-1922]] effectively ends with Turkish victory over the Greeks in [[Smyrna]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk]], the founder of the [[Turkey|Republic of Turkey]], founds the [[Republican People's Party (Turkey)|Republican People's Party]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Hanapepe Massacre]] occurs on [[Kauai]], [[Hawaii]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; In the United States the [[NBC|National Broadcasting Company]] is formed.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Battle of Hel]] begins, the longest-defended pocket of Polish Army resistance during the German [[invasion of Poland]].
*  1939   &ndash; Burmese national hero [[U Ottama]] dies in prison after a [[hunger strike]] to protest Britain's [[British rule in Burma|colonial government]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[George Stibitz]] pioneers the first remote operation of a computer.
*  1940   &ndash; [[Treznea Massacre]]: The [[Military of Hungary|Hungarian Army]], supported by [[Hungarians in Romania|local Hungarians]] kill 93 [[Romanians|Romanian]] civilians in [[Treznea, Sălaj]], a village in [[Northern Transylvania]], as part of attempts to [[ethnic cleansing]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: A [[Empire of Japan|Japan]]ese floatplane [[Lookout Air Raids|drops incendiary bombs]] on [[Oregon]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] land at [[Operation Avalanche|Salerno]] and [[Operation Slapstick|Taranto]], [[Italy]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Fatherland Front (Bulgaria)|Fatherland Front]] takes power in [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] [[Bulgarian coup d'état of 1944|through a military coup]] in the capital and armed rebellion in the country. A new pro-[[Soviet Union|Soviet]] government is established.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: The [[Empire of Japan]] formally surrenders to [[Republic of China (1912-49)|China]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; First case of a [[computer bug]] being found: a [[moth]] lodges in a [[relay]] of a [[Harvard Mark II]] computer at [[Harvard University]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Kim Il-sung]] declares the establishment of the [[North Korea|Democratic People's Republic of Korea]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Elvis Presley]] appears on ''[[The Ed Sullivan Show]]'' for the first time.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of Housing and Urban Development]] is established.
*  1965   &ndash; [[Hurricane Betsy]] makes its second landfall near [[New Orleans, Louisiana]], leaving 76 dead and $1.42 billion ($10–12 billion in 2005 dollars) in damages, becoming the first hurricane to top $1 billion in unadjusted damages.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act]] is signed into law by [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Lyndon B. Johnson]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Allegheny Airlines Flight 853]] [[Douglas DC-9|DC-9]] collides in flight with a [[Piper Cherokee|Piper PA-28]] and crashes near [[Fairland, Indiana|Fairland]], [[Indiana]].
*  1969   &ndash; In [[Canada]], the [[Official Languages Act (Canada)|Official Languages Act]] comes into force, making the [[French language]] equal to the [[English language]] throughout the Federal government.
*[[1970]] &ndash; A [[United Kingdom|British]] airliner is hijacked by the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] and flown to [[Dawson's Field]] in [[Jordan]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The four-day [[Attica Prison riot]] begins, which eventually results in 39 dead, most killed by [[New York State Police|state troopers]] retaking the [[Attica Correctional Facility|prison]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; In [[Kentucky]]'s [[Mammoth Cave National Park]], a Cave Research Foundation exploration and mapping team discovers a link between the Mammoth and Flint Ridge cave systems, making it the longest known cave passageway in the world.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[1990 Batticaloa massacre]], massacre of 184 minority [[Tamil people|Tamil]] civilians by [[Sri Lankan Army]] in the eastern [[Batticaloa District]] of [[Sri Lanka]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Tajikstan]] declares independence from the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; The [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] officially recognizes [[Israel]] as a legitimate state.
* 1999 - Sega releases the first 128 bit video game console the Dreamcast.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Ahmed Shah Massoud]], leader of the [[Afghan Northern Alliance|Northern Alliance]], is assassinated in [[Afghanistan]] by two [[al Qaeda]] assassins who claimed to be Arab journalists wanting an interview.
*  2001   &ndash; [[Pärnu methanol tragedy]] occurs in [[Pärnu County]], [[Estonia]].
*  2001   &ndash;  At exactly 01:46:40 [[Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]], the [[Unix time#Notable events in Unix time|Unix billenium]] is reached, marking the beginning of the use of 10-digit decimal [[Unix time]]stamps.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[2004 Australian embassy bombing]]: A [[bomb]] explodes outside the [[Australia]]n [[embassy]] in [[Jakarta]], killing 10 people.
*[[2009]] &ndash; At exactly 9:09:09 PM, the [[Dubai Metro]], the first urban train network in the Arabian Peninsula, is ceremonially inaugurated.
*[[2010]] &ndash; A [[2010 San Bruno pipeline explosion|natural gas pipeline explosion]] in [[San Bruno, California]], creates a "wall of fire" more than {{convert|1000|ft|m}} high.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[9 September 2012 Iraq attacks|wave of attacks]] kill more than 108 people and injure 351 others in [[Iraq]].
